intro: Mitrella tiwiensis, commonly known as the Tiwi mitrella, is a small, flowering plant native to the island of Tiwi in the Torres Strait. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
